sentences.en: "Come on, Grace," he was urging her, "don't wait, hurry up."
sentences.cn: “快点啦，格雷丝，”他催促道，“别等了。快点。”

sentences.en: "I am in no par-ticular hurry," he insisted.
sentences.cn: “我没什么特别着急的事，”他坚持道。

sentences.en: "It's a thrillI'm in no hurry for," he smiles.
sentences.cn: “我可不想要这种刺激，”他笑着说。

sentences.en: "No need to hurry," Ben said casually.
sentences.cn: “不必急，”本漫不经心地说。

sentences.en: "Oh," he said carelessly. "I'm in no hurry to get back."
sentences.cn: “噢，”他漫不经心地说道，“我不急着回去。”

sentences.en: "Take your time," Cross told him. "I'm in no hurry."
sentences.cn: “慢慢来，”克罗斯对他说，“我一点都不急。”

sentences.en: Dave was in a hurry to get back to work.
sentences.cn: 戴夫急于回到工作岗位。

sentences.en: Don’t hurry me. I’m doing this as fast as I can.
sentences.cn: 别催我，我正在尽快干呢。

sentences.en: Eric left the barge in a hurry.
sentences.cn: 埃里克匆忙离开了驳船。

sentences.en: He was in no hurry to walk down the aisle.
sentences.cn: 他并不急于结婚。

sentences.en: Hurry up with that coffee, will you.
sentences.cn: 请你快点把咖啡端上来。

sentences.en: I don't want to hurry you.
sentences.cn: 我不想催你。

sentences.en: I hate having to hurry a meal.
sentences.cn: 我讨厌匆匆忙忙地吃饭。

sentences.en: I'll need to talk with you, but there's no hurry.
sentences.cn: 我得和你谈谈，但不着急。

sentences.en: I'm in rather a hurry.
sentences.cn: 我很匆忙。

sentences.en: If we hurry, we’ll get there in time.
sentences.cn: 要是赶紧的话，我们能及时到那里。

sentences.en: Patrick often plays up when he knows I'm in a hurry.
sentences.cn: 帕特里克常常明知我手忙脚乱还要调皮捣蛋。

sentences.en: Sorry, I can’t stop, I’m in a hurry.
sentences.cn: 对不起，我不能停下，我赶时间。

sentences.en: There was no longer any reason to hurry.
sentences.cn: 再也不用着急了。

sentences.en: There’s no need to hurry. We’ve got plenty of time.
sentences.cn: 不必匆忙，我们有的是时间。

sentences.en: We’ll have to hurry, otherwise we’ll miss the start.
sentences.cn: 我们得赶紧，否则就会错过开头部分了。

sentences.en: You seem in rather a hurry to get rid of me.
sentences.cn: 看起来你急于想摆脱我。

sentences.en: You’ll make mistakes if you do things in too much of a hurry.
sentences.cn: 做事太仓促会出错。

words.tran_cn: 催促；匆忙进行；急派（hurry的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 匆忙地走，赶紧做，催促，仓促行事
trans.tran_en: to make someone do something more quickly
to do something or go somewhere more quickly than usual, especially because there is not much time
to make someone do something more quickly
